\chapter{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{installation:installation}}\label{\detokenize{installation::doc}}

\section{Python}
\label{\detokenize{installation:python}}
In order to install OCR\sphinxhyphen{}Projet5 you need to use python 3.8+.

If you don’t already have it, please refer to \sphinxhref{https://wiki.python.org/moin/BeginnersGuide/Download}{python’s site}.


\section{Python’s modules}
\label{\detokenize{installation:python-s-modules}}
The modules needed by python are listed in the requirements.txt at the root of the project.

To install module, place yourself at the root of Projet13 and use the command:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pip3 install \sphinxhyphen{}r requirements.txt}}
\end{quote}

For further explanation, see the « DE \sphinxhyphen{} P13 » file

\chapter{gamelenders}
\label{\detokenize{gamelenders:module-gamelenders.urls}}\label{\detokenize{gamelenders:gamelenders}}\label{\detokenize{gamelenders::doc}}\index{gamelenders.urls (module)@\spxentry{gamelenders.urls}\spxextra{module}}
gamelenders URL Configuration
\begin{description}
\item[{The \sphinxtitleref{urlpatterns} list routes URLs to views. For more information please see:}] \leavevmode
\sphinxurl{https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.1/topics/http/urls/}

\end{description}

Examples:
Function views
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {}
Add an import:  from my\_app import views

\item {}
Add a URL to urlpatterns:  path(“”, views.home, name=”home”)

\end{enumerate}
\begin{description}
\item[{Class\sphinxhyphen{}based views}] \leavevmode\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {}
Add an import:  from other\_app.views import Home

\item {}
Add a URL to urlpatterns:  path(“”, Home.as\_view(), name=”home”)

\end{enumerate}

\item[{Including another URLconf}] \leavevmode\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {}
Import the include() function: from django.urls import include, path

\item {}
Add a URL to urlpatterns:  path(“blog/”, include(“blog.urls”))

\end{enumerate}

\end{description}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gamelenders:module-gamelenders.views}}\index{gamelenders.views (module)@\spxentry{gamelenders.views}\spxextra{module}}
Accounts views

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{gamelenders:module-gamelenders.asgi}}\index{gamelenders.asgi (module)@\spxentry{gamelenders.asgi}\spxextra{module}}
ASGI config for gamelenders project.

It exposes the ASGI callable as a module\sphinxhyphen{}level variable named \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{application}}.

For more information on this file, see
\sphinxurl{https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.1/howto/deployment/asgi/}
